Race.SummaryText:
PARISHWIDE PROPOSITION

SUMMARY:  LEVY AND COLLECTION OF A 2.8 MILLS PROPERTY TAX WITHIN THE PARISH OF WASHINGTON, LOUISIANA, BEGINNING WITH THE TAX COLLECTION FOR THE YEAR 2008, AND ANNUALLY THEREAFTER, FOR THE PURPOSE OF PROVIDING FUNDS TO THE WASHINGTON PARISH VOLUNTARY COUNCIL ON THE AGING IN ORDER TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES, DELIVERY OF MEALS, PROVISION OF ON-SITE MEALS, MEDICARE COUNSELING, TELEPHONE MONITORING, A WELLNESS PROGRAM FOR CLIENTS OF THE WASHINGTON PARISH VOLUNTARY COUNCIL ON THE AGING, AND OTHER GENERAL OPERATIONS OF THE WASHINGTON PARISH VOLUNTARY COUNCIL ON THE AGING.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of Washington, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), under the provisions of Article VI, Sections 30 and 32 of the Louisiana Constitution of 1974, as amended, and other constitutional and statutory authority, be authorized to levy and collect, and adopt an ordinance providing for such levy and collection, of a special ad valorem tax of 2.8 mills on the dollar of assessed valuation on all property subject to taxation within the boundaries of the Parish (the "Tax") (an estimated $271,648 is reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for the entire year), beginning with the tax collection for the year 2008, and annually thereafter, and shall said Tax (after paying reasonable and necessary expenses of collecting and administering the Tax) be used entirely and exclusively for the purpose of providing funds to the Washington Parish Voluntary Council on the Aging in order to provide transportation services, delivery of meals, provision of on-site meals, Medicare counseling, telephone monitoring, a wellness program for clients of the Washington Parish Voluntary Council on the Aging, and other general operations of the Washington Parish Voluntary Council on the Aging?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Bogalusa -- Prop.#1 - 1/4% S&U - Council
Race.SummaryText:
PROPOSITION NO. 1
(1/4% SALES TAX RENEWAL)
(INDUSTRIAL PARK)

SUMMARY:  1/4% SALES TAX RENEWAL FOR THE CITY OF BOGALUSA, FOR (I) IMPROVING AND/OR MAINTAINING THE CITY'S INDUSTRIAL PARK, (II) CONSTRUCTING ADDITIONS AND IMPROVEMENTS TO EXISTING BUILDINGS IN THE INDUSTRIAL PARK AND (III) CONSTRUCTING, ACQUIRING AND IMPROVING ADDITIONAL BUILDINGS THEREIN.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Bogalusa, State of Louisiana (the "City"), under the provisions of Article VI, Section 29 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, and other constitutional and statutory authority, be authorized to continue to levy and collect a tax of one-quarter of one percent (1/4%) (the "Tax"), commencing February 1, 2008, upon the sale at retail, the use, the lease or rental, the consumption, and the storage for use or consumption, of tangible personal property and on sales of services in the City, all as defined in La. R.S. 47:301 to 47:317, inclusive, with the proceeds of the Tax (after paying the reasonable and necessary costs and expenses of collection and administering the Tax), to be dedicated and used for (i) improving and/or maintaining the City's industrial park, (ii) constructing additions and improvements to existing building in the industrial park and (iii) constructing, acquiring and improving additional buildings therein? (estimated annual revenues: $540,000)

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Bogalusa -- Prop.#2-2.71 Mill-Council-10Yrs.-Fire Dept.
Race.SummaryText:
PROPOSITION NO. 2
(MILLAGE RENEWAL)
(FIRE DEPARTMENT)

SUMMARY: 10-YEAR 2.71-MILL TAX RENEWAL FOR MAINTAINING FIRE DEPARTMENT STATIONS AND EQUIPMENT, AND FOR PAYING THE GENERAL OPERATIONS THEREOF AND SALARIES OF THE PERSONNEL OF THE FIRE DEPARTMENT.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Bogalusa, State of Louisiana, under the provisions of Article VI, Sections 30 and 32 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, continue to levy and collect a special tax of two and seventy-one hundredths (2.71) mills on all the property subject to taxation within said City, for a period of ten (10) years beginning with the year 2008 and ending with the year 2017, inclusive, for the purpose of maintaining fire department stations and equipment, and for paying the general operations thereof and salaries of the personnel of the fire department? (estimated annual revenues: $150,000)

Race.SummaryText:
PROPOSITION NO. 3
(MILLAGE RENEWAL)
(SEWERAGE, WATER, STREETS AND PARKS)

SUMMARY:  10-YEAR 2.71-MILL TAX RENEWAL FOR MAINTAINING SEWERAGE AND WATER WORKS AND OTHER WORKS OF PERMANENT IMPROVEMENT UNDER THE JURISDICTION OF THE DEPARTMENT OF STREETS AND PARKS.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Bogalusa, State of Louisiana, under the provisions of Article VI, Sections 30 and 32 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, continue to levy and collect a special tax of two and seventy-one hundredths (2.71) mills on all the property subject to taxation within said City, for a period of ten (10) years beginning with the year 2008 and ending with the year 2017, inclusive, for the purpose of maintaining sewerage and water works and other works of permanent improvement under the jurisdiction of the Department of Streets and Parks? (estimated annual revenues: $150,000)

Race.SummaryText:
PROPOSITION NO. 4
(MILLAGE RENEWAL)
(MUNICIPAL SERVICES)

SUMMARY:  10-YEAR 3.62-MILL TAX RENEWAL FOR PROVIDING
MUNICIPAL SERVICES IN THE CITY, AND FOR THE MAINTENANCE AND OPERATION OF MUNICIPAL SERVICES DEPARTMENTS, INCLUDING THE ACQUISITION OF NECESSARY EQUIPMENT THEREFOR, AND PAYING SALARIES OF THE PERSONNEL OF SAID DEPARTMENTS.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Bogalusa, State of Louisiana, under the provisions of Article VI, Sections 30 and 32 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, continue to levy and collect a special tax of three and sixty-two hundredths (3.62) mills on all the property subject to taxation within said City, for a period of ten (10) years beginning with the year 2008 and ending with the year 2017, inclusive, for the purpose of providing municipal services in the City, and for the maintenance and operation of municipal services departments, including the acquisition of necessary equipment therefore, and paying salaries of the personnel of said departments? (estimated annual revenues:  $205,000)

Race.SpecificTitle: Village of Angie -- 1% S&U - Mayor & BOA
Race.SummaryText:
VILLAGE OF ANGIE PROPOSITION
(SALES TAX REDEDICATION)

SUMMARY:  REDEDICATION OF AN EXISTING 1% SALES TAX IN THE VILLAGE OF ANGIE, AS FOLLOWS: (I) 50% FOR CONSTRUCTING, EXTENDING, IMPROVING AND MAINTAINING PUBLIC STREETS, ROADS, SIDEWALKS AND BRIDGES, SEWERAGE AND WATER WORKS AND OTHER WORKS OF PERMANENT PUBLIC IMPROVEMENT OWNED BY THE VILLAGE AND (II) 50% FOR ANY LAWFUL MUNICIPAL PURPOSES.
Race.FullText: Shall the Village of Angie, State of Louisiana (the "Village"), under the provisions of Article VI, Section 29 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, and other constitutional and statutory authority, be authorized to rededicate the proceeds of an existing one percent (1%) sales and use tax originally authorized pursuant to an election held in the Village on March 19, 1957, and Ordinance No. 9A adopted by the governing authority of the Village on June 1, 1957, effective January 1, 2008, for the following purposes: (i) 50% for constructing, extending, improving and maintaining public streets, roads, sidewalks and bridges, sewerage and water works and other works of permanent public improvement owned by the Village and (ii) 50% for any lawful municipal purposes of the Village? (estimated annual revenues: $60,000)
